summary: Clostridium difficile infection (CDI) is recognised as an emerging disease in humans and some animal species. certain ribotypes (RT) are possibly associated with zoonotic transmission. a new RT isolate was found in a faecal sample of an exotic animal. additional files Additional file 1: (1.4MB, jpg) cdu1-cdd1 PCR (700 bp) agarose gel image. Lane 1 C. difficile E6 strain, lanes 2–6 field isolates, lane 7 positive control, lane 8 negative control. molecular mass (upper arrows point to 3 kb fragment and lower arrows point to 1 kb fragment)
